data.description: JOB DESCRIPTIONYou will be working in the State Street Investment Management  IT Architecture Database Engineering Group. Our mission is to get up to speed on supporting the State Street IM infrastructure and database engineering needs from a project management perspective: POC’s, migration, transformation, and builds to support business critical applications at an enterprise level. This job offers a great opportunity for you to take part in building up a competency center for coordinating between many technical teams to deliver critical projects. You will be a part of a diverse team of co-ops, contractors and employees working on creative solutions with application teams. Further, you will be given the chance to learn in a dynamic and welcoming environment within a competitive, global industry.YOUR PRIMARY JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES -  Coordinate multiple projects as an intern project coordinator with scrum tool-  Maintain team SharePoint site, wiki, and run book-  Coding opportunities with data pipeline and cloud services for proof of concept-  Create and maintain project plans, architectural diagrams, and workflows-  Document and post meeting minutes and agendas-  Create test plans, document results, and write metrics/status reports-  Create presentationsMINIMUM JOB SPECIFICATIONS -  Currently Enrolled in Bachelors in Computer Science, IT or related field-  Strong Documentation Skills- Strong Excel skills-  Familiarity with MS Project, MS Visio, Tableau-  Good programming/scripting skills (python, shell, java)-  Solid attention to detail, results oriented, analytical and communication skills-  Ability to work alone and in a team-  Eager to learn and research unfamiliar topics-  Sense of humor and love of food are not necessary, but are certainly welcomeSKILL OPPORTUNITIES YOU WILL DEVELOP -  Project Management-  Presentation and Playbooks-  Establishing processes and methodologies-  Database Systems-  Enterprise Data Warehouse-  Cloud Technologies-  POC’g new products and product research-  Tableau data analytics and visualizations-  Microsoft Office Tool Suite-  SharePoint Workflows and Sites-  Unix (Solaris and Linux)-  Containers/Microservices-  Programming and scripting in a variety of environments and languagesAbout State StreetWhat we do: State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we are making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we have been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients. We genuinely believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.  State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Salary Range: The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.Employees are eligible to participate in State Street’s comprehensive benefits program, which includes: our retirement savings plan (401K) with company match; insurance coverage including basic life, medical, dental, vision, long-term disability, and other optional additional coverages; paid-time off including vacation, sick leave, short term disability, and family care responsibilities; access to our Employee Assistance Program; incentive compensation including eligibility for annual performance-based awards (excluding certain sales roles subject to sales incentive plans); and, eligibility for certain tax advantaged savings plans.For a full overview, visit https://hrportal.ehr.com/statestreet/Home.About State StreetAcross the globe, institutional investors rely on us to help them manage risk, respond to challenges, and drive performance and profitability. We keep our clients at the heart of everything we do, and smart, engaged employees are essential to our continued success.We are committed to fostering an environment where every employee feels valued and empowered to reach their full potential. As an essential partner in our shared success, you’ll benefit from inclusive development opportunities, flexible work-life support, paid volunteer days, and vibrant employee networks that keep you connected to what matters most. Join us in shaping the future.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we consider all qualified applicants for all positions without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, age, disability, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, marital status, domestic partnership or civil union status, familial status, military and veteran status, and other characteristics protected by applicable law.Discover more information on jobs at StateStreet.com/careersRead our CEO StatementJob Application Disclosure: It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
